Review Title: Worth my money and time. Must Watch Detective Movie.
Review: No profanity. No romance. No item song or duets. No bada or famous actors. But then this film is worth your money and time. The best Detective movie after *Megastar's Chantabbai*. *Naveen Polishetty* did a remarkable job and has proved a movie doesn't require all the above things if you have right story placed with right screenplay. Hatsoff to the debutant director *Swaroop RSJ* for giving such an interesting movie by trusting solely on the story. Background music is amazing, you will feel the tense and will be on the edge of your seats. Perfectüî•üî•üôè

Review Title: One of the best films in TFI in recent years
Review: As a fan of detective/thriller movies, I couldn't miss this and I'm even more surprised by how much I loved this movie which usually doesn't happen when I watch a hyped movie. So thankful to Naveen for bringing this brilliant mystery to Telugu audience and dealing with a subject that's making a fool of the innocents. However, the sad thing remains that the film is unable to reach that set of audience.Coming to the performances, Naveen just nailed it, the way he balances humor, emotion, and intelligence is commendable. Shruthi also did her job very well. It was good to see Suhas as the Kannada version of Agent (although he could've been used better). The screenplay was tight, always keeps you guessing till the end, lots of twists which don't seem to be coming. The pace of the film was so good that you can't think of anything else or search for goofs. The exposition in the film feels justified and that's not very common in Tollywood. There were little cons but that's negligible consider how power-packed the whole movie is, it's a must watch for everyone and I hope there's more to come from Naveen and Swaroop for the Telugu Film Industry.

Review Title: Got to watch this enthralling 'Telugu' film and atlast my Amazon subscription feels 'Worth it'
Review: Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya is nothing like films I've watched. It has a new theme, new story, new awareness to make and I salute the makers for coming up with it. Not only that, the screenplay was really great, the lead actor was charming as hell and the humor works out even for one who gets a bit of Telugu and reads a lot of subtitles. The only disappointment in my case was that the actors who spoke 'bad' Tamil in a scene. The directors will have to do enough work before casting such actors or making Telugu vadus speak Tamil or any other language because Tamil is not alien to us. We are not living in Japan and creating German Title song with bad pronunciation. We speak Dravidian, why not be Dravidian as well? Next time, I wish they show the same level of acceptance with Tamil and Malayalam languages as well as they are showering towards Kannada. It's definitely a good changeover from ever masala Telugu film industry and hope this trend continues instead of following films like Bahubali. Big budget flop film. We don't want that, right?

Review Title: Intelligently made film - Don't miss it.
Review: I wanted to watch this movie once I watched the trailer. However, I couldn't catch it while it was being played in theaters because it didn't release in UAE. However, I watched this movie once it came out in Amazon Prime (I am very thankful that they got the rights to stream) and I loved every bit of the movie.I won't reveal any plot or even provide you with a story because whoever is reading this review and thinking whether to watch this movie, I don't want to ruin anything for them and answer simply by saying "WATCH IT!". You will enjoy it.It's intelligently made movie, with good characterizations and arcs. The concept itself is an eye-opener for everyone. It has everything for everyone. If you're a person who is into enjoying a movie then this is more than a feast. So, go ahead and watch it.

Review Title: MORNING DOESN'T ALWAYS SHOW THE DAY
Review: This movie is a perfect example of "MORNING DOESN'T ALWAYS SHOW THE DAY" because the initial comedy of the movie turns to be a nail-biting crime thriller. Sai Srinivasa Athreya (Naveen), who proclaimed to be a detective and followed Sherlock Holmes as idol, was a funny but intelligent person. He desperately seek an opportunity to prove his worth and strength as a detective. His assistant Sneha (Shruti Sharma) followed her boss despite knowing that he is not a well known detective. Due to the nosy nature of being a detective, Sai once found an unknown deadbody besides railroad track and eventually arrested by police as a suspect. Police kept him at the lock-up and planned to put charge against him. In the cell, Sai met an old man who requested him to find out the culprits of his dead daughter who brutally raped and killed her. Sai considered it as a chance of raising himself as a prominent detective in the country and start investigating immediately after getting bail from the court. However, the apparent murder case turns into an unexpected twists and turns and Sai and his team had to deal with a dangerous crime group. Acting of Naveen was really amazing. He is a good actor. Glad to know that he wrote screenplay of this movie as well. Really a NAVEEN SHOW which was worth to watch. Shruti was a beautiful lady and performed very well. Direction and music were up to the mark.

Review: Agent Sai Srinivasa Athreya. In all aspects of the film, it is completely amazing. The cast nailed it, especially Naveen Polishetty. Shurti Sharma, Suhas, Ramdutt, Shredha Rajagopalan, and the rest of the cast also did a really good job. What I love about this film is that it isn't just a thriller, but it also balances loads of comedy, drama, and emotion all without missing out in any other areas. This film is really good and I recommend that people who love the thriller genre watch it. 10/10 Stars.
